body:
It should work if you set up your development environment according to the [guide](https://netty.io/wiki/developer-guide.html).
This looks like it might be an issue with the optional brotli dependency? /cc @hyperxpro

`Caused by: java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: Unsupported OS and Architecture: Mac OS X, aarch64`

This is expected because Brotli4j is not supported on macOS aarch64. There is an open [PR](https://github.com/hyperxpro/Brotli4j/pull/34) for M1 support but GitHub Actions don't support M1 yet so it's not merged yet.

Will have a look 

> Am 20.01.2022 um 04:47 schrieb Aayush Atharva ***@***.***>:
> 
> ﻿
> Caused by: java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: Unsupported OS and Architecture: Mac OS X, aarch64
> 
> This is expected because Brotli4j is not supported on macOS aarch64. There is an open PR for M1 support but GitHub Actions don't support M1 yet so it's not merged yet.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or unsubscribe.
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.

Alright, this test should not have been initialized on OSX aarch64.

@normanmaurer Is this on your list or I should fix this?
@hyperxpro please do if you have time... I have some other stuff todo first.

issue.title: Use BeforeAll instead of static block to load Brotli4j library

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:
As of today, Brotli4j does not support macOS aarch64. Currently, in `BrotliEncoderTest`, we use the static block to load the Brotli4j library. However, this could lead to failure when performing this action on macOS aarch64.

The `DisabledIf` loads the `BrotliEncoderTest` class to see if the platform is supported or not. Loading this class triggers the static block which eventually leads to `ExceptionInInitializerError`.

Modification:
Use `BeforeAll` instead of static block.

Result:
Fixes #12024

body:
@normanmaurer  or @chrisvest I am trying to build Netty from source to test out your fix for my issue before 4.1.74 is released and I'm running into issues building. I pulled the latest source and I don't get the Brotli4j error anymore..however..

On My ARM Mac I get a different error than my X86

**ARM**
When I run ```mvn clean install``` from the Netty main directory after a while the. build fails with:

```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal on project netty-handler: Could not resolve dependencies for project io.netty:netty-handler:jar:4.1.74.Final-SNAPSHOT: io.netty:netty-tcnative:jar:osx-aarch_64:2.0.48.Final was not found in https://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2 during a previous attempt. This failure was cached in the local repository and resolution is not reattempted until the update interval of central has elapsed or updates are forced -> [Help 1]
```

I see a bunch of these messages in the output, which seems to indicate the native libraries aren't being built in and installed as part of the main Netty build? 

I followed the instructions on BOTH machines to build the native transports, at least the little instructions that are there and not sure if I need to do anything else to get the libraries to build.

```Building the MacOS/BSD native transport
To build the native transport, you need to use MacOS 10.12 or higher. Please also install the required tools and libraries:

brew install autoconf automake libtool
```
@tmulle On MacOS/M1, try enabling the `-Pboringssl-osx-arch64` profile.

@chrisvest Thanks..getting further (I think)...The build fails with this error, which looks related to the `Brotoli` libs..

@tmulle This error was fixed in recent commit. Please rebase and try again.
